snippet: The Port Authority and its terminal’s paying bus lines want the city to relocate MegaBus from the adjacent sidewalk sites that it uses rent-free.
abstract: Discount bus line MegaBus, with no permanent terminal in New York City, faces objections once again from rival companies, along with the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey and Community Board 4 in Manhattan, all of whom want the line relocated from its most recent pickup sites near the Port Authority Bus Terminal; Port Authority officials say they plan to meet with MegaBus executives to discuss long-term solutions.
lead_paragraph: The Port Authority and its terminal’s paying bus lines want the city to relocate MegaBus from the adjacent sidewalk sites that it uses rent-free.

headline.seo: MegaBus Faces Opposition to Manhattan Pick-Up Sites
headline.main: Discount Bus Line Faces Opposition on Sidewalk Pick-Up Sites Near Terminal
headline.print_headline: Discount Bus Line Faces Opposition on Sidewalk Pick-Up Sites Near Terminal

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
